text: Henry Lafayette King (April 7, 1922 – June 5, 1983) was an American football player who played four seasons in the All-America Football Conference. "Fay" King played college football at the University of Georgia.He was drafted by the Rams of the National Football League in the seventh round of the 1946 NFL Draft. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:1983 deaths Category:Buffalo Bisons (AAFC) players Category:American football ends Category:Georgia Bulldogs football players Category:Players of American football from Alabama Category:Buffalo Bills (AAFC) players Category:Chicago Rockets players Category:Chicago Hornets players
title: Fay King
